autoProficiency.name: Automatically Add Proficiency Bonus to Attack Rolls

integrationWithPolyglot.name: Integration with Polyglot
integrationWithPolyglot.hint: Set up different rolltable one for each language and change the audio file with customized one for that language

notehidelabel.name: Hide Environment Interaction Note Label
notehidelabel.hint: If checked only the icon will appear

notecolorlabel.name: Change Color when Notes are present
notecolorlabel.hint: Change Color when Notes are present

acelibDefaultShow.name: Show Macro editor by default
acelibDefaultShow.hint: Shows the code editor by default instead of the default editor

delayedTimeBeforeDeleteTheEnvironmentIte.name: Delayed time in seconds before delete the environment item
delayedTimeBeforeDeleteTheEnvironmentIte.hint: Duration in seconds before delete the environment item. This is a 'can't avoid feature', When using automatize modules like MidiQol the module will not allow the attack to be rolled from the chat card or other 'after' mechanisms (as the item no longer exists on the actor at the point where that attack is clicked), and will pop an error that "the requested item (id) no longer exists on the actor (name)".There is a optional integration with the 'Hurry up' module if present and active.

debug.name: Enable debugging
debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console

interactWithEnvironment.selectTokenWarn: Select a token to interact with environment.
interactWithEnvironment.noValidRequestWarn: The string request for tokenbar module is not a valid one
interactWithEnvironment.title: Select Action

note.label: Environment Interaction Note
note.event-use-environment-interaction: ENABLE: Enable this item for the environment interaction, will become invisible for all non GM player and will show up on the interaction  item list, it will apply with css a background color to these items in the inventory
note.event-use-item-macro: ITEM MACRO: Enable the item macro integration, if this enable will launch the macro setted with the module 'item macro' (if present or it will do nothing), and will ignore the 'EVENT','SUCCESS' and 'FAILURE' settings
note.event-use-item-environment: ITEM ENVIRONMENT: Enable the use of the environment token instead the standard use, where the action is launched like the item was in the inventory of the interactor token (the player usually). ATTENTION : If is a contested roll is a contested roll with himself
note.event-use-as-macro: EVENT AS MACRO: This checkbox set up the 'EVENT' like a input macro. The macro MUST return a numeric value to compare with the DC for acknowledge a 'SUCCESS' or a 'FAILURE'
note.event-detail: DETAIL: the sub-label with some additional info on the voice
note.event-info: INFO: dialog showed up when click on the information icon if you want to show some information before click
note.event-explicit-dc: DC o NUMBER FLAG: This is the number to check with the result of the 'EVENT'. If the result of 'EVENT' is >= of this value is a success else a failure
note.event: EVENT: the label for manage the interaction, or a macro with a return number for compare with the DC
note.event-condition: CONDITION: Macro/Code for decide if the interactor token can see the voice
note.event-success: SUCCESS: Macro/Code to run when the interaction is consider a success
note.event-failure: FAILURE: Macro/Code to run when the interaction is consider a failure
note.event-note-about-settings: You need the advanced settings only for when you need to automatically compare the value with a reference dc value for very high level triggers. From experience I can say that almost nobody uses this part of the module, 99% of the masters do the comparison and trigger the trigger manually.

environment-interaction-multisystem.macroExecution: There was an error in your macro syntax. See the console (F12) for details
